com.ibm.team.interop.client

Interface IInteropManager


  • public interface IInteropManager
    Provides operations of proxy objects. This is the client interface (or client API) for the Interop component.

    Team repository objects are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on ITeamRepository and its various subsidiaries, including IInteropManager, can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

    Since:
    0.5

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null
        See Also:
        ITeamRepository.itemManager()

      • saveProxy

        IExternalProxy saveProxy(IExternalProxy proxyWorkingCopy,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Update the given proxy in the repository. The proxy passed in must be a working copy whose property values describe the new current state of the proxy in the repository. Returns the complete, shared item for the proxy. Subsequent changes must be made from a new working copy obtained from the resulting shared item. The working copy passed in is not affected, but cannot be reused.

        Note that this method cannot be used to update the replicated external state associated with the proxy; it can only be used to update other intrinsic properties of the proxy itself (e.g. the synchronization rule to use). To both update a proxy's intrinsic properties and set new replicated state from an external object (optionally triggering incoming synchronization), use #saveProxy(IExternalProxy, Map, boolean, IProgressMonitor). To just update a proxy's replicated state and trigger synchronization, use #synchronizeIncoming(IExternalProxy, ISyncRule, IProgressMonitor)

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxyWorkingCopy - a working copy describing the new or updated proxy; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • saveProxyWithTargetItem

        IExternalProxy saveProxyWithTargetItem(IExternalProxy proxy,
                                     IItemHandle targetItemHandle,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Save a new or updated proxy for an external object that is to be linked to a Jazz item. The incoming proxy object can be either a newly-created item (in memory) or a working copy of an existing item.

        A proxy must always be associated with an external object (identified by a URI) and/or a Jazz item. If the targetItemHandle argument is non-null, then either the proxy must not already exist, or it must already be associated with the same item. Once created, such an association cannot be changed.

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; either a new item or a working copy; never null
        targetItemHandle - the handle of the associated Jazz item, or null if existing proxy is already linked to an item
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • saveProxyWithUri

        IExternalProxy saveProxyWithUri(IExternalProxy proxy,
                              java.net.URI uri,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Create or update the given proxy in the repository. The proxy passed in must be a either a new item or a working copy whose property values describe the new current state of the proxy in the repository. Returns the complete, shared item for the proxy. Subsequent changes must be made from a new working copy obtained from the resulting shared item. The proxy object passed in is not affected, but cannot be reused.

        A proxy must always be associated with some external object (identified by a URI) and/or a Jazz item. If the uri argument is non-null, then either the proxy must not already exist, or it must already be associated with the same external object. Once created, such an association cannot be changed.

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxy - a new item or working copy describing the new or updated proxy; must not be null
        uri - the URI of the external object, or null if existing proxy is already linked to an external object
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • saveProxyWithState

        IExternalProxy saveProxyWithState(IExternalProxy proxyWorkingCopy,
                                IExternalState stateWorkingCopy,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Update both a proxy and the replicated external state for an external object in the repository. If incoming synchronization is configured for the proxy (via a synchronization rule), then it is scheduled. The proxy argument must be a working copy of an existing item; the external state object must be a new item or a working copy.

        The replicated state consists of a set of properties (i.e. name/value pairs), where both names and values are Strings.

        To update a proxy without changing its replicated state or triggering synchronization, use saveProxy(IExternalProxy, IProgressMonitor). To update replicated state and trigger synchronization without otherwise modifying a proxy, use saveExternalState(IExternalState, IProgressMonitor)

        Note that this method first saves the proxy itself to the repository, along with the replicated state and any other properties of the proxy that have been modified. The proxy object that is returned represents the state of the proxy after it has been saved, but before any synchronization occurs. The returned object is a complete, shared item.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxyWorkingCopy - a working copy of an existing item; must not be null
        stateWorkingCopy - a new item or a working copy; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • saveProxyWithStateAndUri

        IExternalProxy saveProxyWithStateAndUri(IExternalProxy proxyWorkingCopy,
                                      IExternalState stateWorkingCopy,
                                      java.net.URI uri,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Create or update the given proxy in the repository, along with the replicated state of an external object. If incoming synchronization is configured for the proxy (via a synchronization rule), then it is scheduled. Both the proxy and external state arguments be a either new items or a working copies of existing items.

        A proxy must always be associated with some external object (identified by a URI). If the uri argument is non-null, then either the proxy must not already exist, or it must already be associated with the same external object. Once created, such an association cannot be changed.

        The replicated state consists of a set of properties (i.e. name/value pairs), where both names and values are Strings.

        To update a proxy without changing its replicated state or triggering synchronization, use saveProxy(IExternalProxy, IProgressMonitor). To update replicated state and trigger synchronization without otherwise modifying a proxy, use saveExternalState(IExternalState, IProgressMonitor)

        Note that this method first saves the proxy itself to the repository, along with the replicated state and any other properties of the proxy that have been modified. The proxy object that is returned represents the state of the proxy after it has been saved, but before any synchronization occurs. The returned object is a complete, shared item.

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxyWorkingCopy - a new item or working copy; must not be null
        stateWorkingCopy - a new item or a working copy; must not be null
        uri - the URI of the external object, or null if existing proxy is already linked to an external object
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • findProxybyTargetItem

        IExternalProxy findProxybyTargetItem(IItemHandle targetItem,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve any proxy for an external object that is being synchronized with a Jazz item, if any.

        If the proxy is found, this operation adds the proxy to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        targetItem - the target item of the proxy; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the proxy, or null if none
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • findProxybyUri

        IExternalProxy findProxybyUri(java.net.URI uri,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve any proxy that may be replicating an external object.

        If the proxy is found, this operation adds the proxy to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        uri - the external object URI; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the complete, shared item for the proxy, or null if none
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • findProxiesBySyncRule

        IExternalProxyHandle[] findProxiesBySyncRule(ISyncRuleHandle syncRuleHandle,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve any proxies that reference a particular synchronization rule (or no synchronization rule at all).
        Parameters:
        syncRuleHandle - handle for the synchronization rule being referenced, or null to find proxies that reference no synchronization rule at all
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        array of handles for the found proxies; never null; may be empty
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • findExternalStatebyUri

        IExternalState findExternalStatebyUri(java.net.URI uri,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve any external state for a proxy identified by an external URI. If there is such a proxy, and it has external state, then the latest state is returned.

        If the external state item is found, this operation adds the item to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        uri - the external object URI; never null
        Returns:
        the complete, shared item for the external state, or null if none
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getExternalState

        IExternalState getExternalState(IExternalProxy proxy,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the replicated state associated with a proxy. This method can be used to get an external state object which can be used to create a working copy for updating.

        Note that, if this proxy is being synchronized with a Jazz item, the returned state may not yet have been synchronized - it represents the latest state received from the external object.

        If the external state item is found, this operation adds the item to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the the external state associated with the proxy, or null if there is no external state, or if the proxy state was fetched partially and does not include the external state property
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is an error getting the state from the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getLastSyncedInExternalState

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getLastSyncedInExternalState(IExternalProxy proxy,
                                                                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the last replicated state associated with a proxy that was synchronized into a Jazz item. In other words, the returned state (if any) was the most recent state successfully used as the source of incoming synchronization with a Jazz item.

        If the proxy has no associated replicated state, or it was never synchronized in the incoming direction with a Jazz item, then null is returned.

        Note that this method does not return an IExternalState object since, in general, the last-synced-in external state may not be the latest state, and so cannot be used as the basis of an update (i.e. a working copy). For that, use getExternalState(IExternalProxy, IProgressMonitor) instead.

        The replicated state is not cached in the proxy object, so it is inefficient to make repeated calls to this method. In particular, it would be bad to do something like this, since the entire state would be fetched with each call. 

           String val1 = (String) getLastSynchronizedState.get("name1");
   String val2 = (String) getLastSynchronizedState.get("name2");
   ...
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the replicated state that was last synced into a Jazz item, as a map of property name/value pairs, where both the names and values are Strings; null if there is no replicated state, or it was never synchronized, or if this proxy state was fetched partially and does not include the replicated state property
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is an error getting the state from the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getLastSyncedOutExternalState

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getLastSyncedOutExternalState(IExternalProxy proxy,
                                                                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the last replicated state associated with a proxy that a Jazz item was synchronized into. In other words, the returned state (if any) was the most recent state that was successfully created as a result of outgoing synchronization with a Jazz item.

        If the proxy has no associated replicated state, or it was never synchronized in the outgoing direction with a Jazz item, then null is returned.

        Note that this method does not return an IExternalState object since, in general, the last-synced-out external state may not be the latest state, and so cannot be used as the basis of an update (i.e. a working copy). For that, use getExternalState(IExternalProxy, IProgressMonitor) instead.

        The replicated state is not cached in the proxy object, so it is inefficient to make repeated calls to this method. In particular, it would be bad to do something like this, since the entire state would be fetched with each call. 

           String val1 = (String) getLastSynchronizedState.get("name1");
   String val2 = (String) getLastSynchronizedState.get("name2");
   ...
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the replicated state that was last synced out from a Jazz item, as a map of property name/value pairs, where both the names and values are Strings; null if there is no replicated state, or it was never synchronized, or if this proxy state was fetched partially and does not include the replicated state property
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is an error getting the state from the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getLatestState

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getLatestState(IExternalProxy proxy,
                                                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the latest replicated state associated with a proxy. This is just a convenience method for the sequence of calls 
             getExternalState(proxy).getState()
        Note that, if this proxy is being synchronized with a Jazz item, the returned state may not yet have been synchronized - it represents the latest state received from the external object.

        The replicated state is not cached in the proxy object, so it is inefficient to make repeated calls to this method. In particular, it would be bad to do something like this, since the entire state would be fetched with each call. 

           String val1 = (String) getLatestState.get("name1");
   String val2 = (String) getLatestState.get("name2");
   ...
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the latest replicated state associated with the proxy, as a map of property name/value pairs, where both the names and values are Strings; null if there is no replicated state, or if this proxy state was fetched partially and does not include the replicated state property
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is an error getting the state from the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • saveExternalState

        IExternalState saveExternalState(IExternalState stateWorkingCopy,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Update the replicated state for an external object in the repository. The object passed in must be a working copy whose IExternalState.REPLICATED_STATE_PROPERTY property has been set to the new replicated state of an external object. Returns the complete, shared item for the proxy. Subsequent changes must be made from a new working copy obtained from the resulting shared item. The working copy passed in is not affected, but cannot be reused.

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        stateWorkingCopy - a working copy describing the new or updated replicated state; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the external state; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getUri

        java.net.URI getUri(IExternalProxyHandle proxy,
                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the URI for an external object that is represented by a proxy.
        Parameters:
        proxy - the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the URI of the external object that the proxy is linked to; may be null
        Throws:

        ItemNotFoundException - if there is no external object link
        TeamRepositoryException - if a sync rule for the external type already exists, or anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getTargetItemState

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getTargetItemState(IExternalProxyHandle proxyHandle,
                                                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the properties of a Jazz item that is being synchronized with an external object, given the proxy for the external object. The properties returned are those defined to be synchronized (in either direction) by the synchronization rule attached to the proxy.

        THIS METHOD IS TENTATIVE AND SHOULD NOT BE USED OUTSIDE THE INTEROP COMPONENT

        Parameters:
        proxyHandle - the handle for the external proxy
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a map containing the item properties being synchronized in either direction, or null if there is no target item being synchronized
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is an error getting the state from the repository

      • getBlockingProxies

                                        boolean incoming,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get any proxies that are blocking synchronization of a given proxy, in the specified direction.

        incoming - if true, return proxies blocking incoming synchronization; if false, return proxies blocking outgoing synchronization

        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong

      • saveSyncRule

        ISyncRule saveSyncRule(ISyncRule syncRuleWorkingCopy,
                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Save a new or updated synchronization rule to the repository. The incoming sync rule object must be either a new item or a working copy of an existing item. The sync rule must also be associated with a project area.

        Returns the complete, shared item for the proxy. Subsequent changes must be made from a new working copy obtained from the resulting shared item. The sync rule object passed in is not affected, but cannot be reused.

        Updating an existing item fails by throwing ItemNotFoundException if the item being updated does not exist.

        The operation fails by throwing StaleDataException if the working copy is not based on the current state of the item in the repository at the time the server processes the save request. A client wishing to handle this mid-air collision should (1) re-fetch the current state of the item, (2) create a new working copy from it, (3) copy over changes from the old working copy, and (4) save the new working copy.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        Parameters:
        syncRuleWorkingCopy - a working copy describing the new or updated sync rule; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a complete, shared item for the sync rule; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        Since:
        0.6

      • findSyncRule

      • isSynchronizationEnabled

        boolean isSynchronizationEnabled(ISyncRule syncRule,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Determine whether synchronization is enabled for a particular synchronization rule. If synchronization is disabled, then attempts to update any ExternalState or ExternalProxy object associated with the synchronization rule will fail, and any synchronization attempt will be ignored. This is normally done by a client in preparation for deleting a synchronization rule.
        Parameters:
        syncRule - the synchronization rule to check
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        true if synchronization is enabled, false if not
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if synchronization rule does not exist in repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        Since:
        0.6

        void setSynchronizationEnabled(ISyncRule syncRule,
                             boolean enabled,
                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Set whether synchronization is enabled for a synchronization rule. By default, synchronization is enabled.

        enabled - true to enable synchronization, false to disable it
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:

      • getLastSearchTime

        java.sql.Timestamp getLastSearchTime(ISyncRule syncRule,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get the time of the most recent scan for outgoing changes that was done for the given synchronization rule, if any.
        Parameters:
        syncRule - the synchronization rule to get the last search time for
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the time of the last outgoing synchronization scan, or null if one has never been done
        Throws:

      • resetLastSearchTime

        void resetLastSearchTime(ISyncRule syncRule,
                       boolean asAllModified,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Clear the time of the most recent scan for outgoing changes that was done for the given synchronization rule.

        The time can be cleared in two ways: as if outgoing synchronization has never been run, in which case the next scan will consider all items covered by the synchronization rule that have been modified since the synchronization rule was last modified, or as if the last scan occurred before the existence of any item, so that all existing items covered by the synchronization rule are considered.

        Parameters:
        syncRule - the synchronization rule to reset the last search time for
        asAllModified - if false, next scan will consider only items modified after the sync rule; if true, next scan will consider all existing items covered by the sync rule
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if synchronization rule does not exist in repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        Since:
        0.6

      • synchronizeIncoming

        void synchronizeIncoming(IExternalProxyHandle proxyHandle,
                       IExternalStateHandle xstateHandle,
                       IAuditableHandle syncedItemStateHandle,
                       ISyncRuleHandle syncRuleHandle,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of a Jazz item with the state of an external object. The external object is represented by its proxy. If a Jazz item is already associated with the proxy, it is updated (if possible); otherwise, a new item is created (if possible).

        If the xstateHandle argument is not null, then it must be a state handle (not just an item handle), and synchronization will be done with respect to the particular state supplied. Otherwise, synchronization will be done with respect to the latest external state associated with the proxy at the time the request is processed.

        The synchronization request is put at the end of a queue of any other pending requests for the same proxy object, and this method returns immediately.

        Note that if no incoming synchronization is configured (either because there is no sync rule, or it does not specify incoming synchronization), then this method does nothing.

        Normally, synchronization is scheduled every time the replicated state for an external object is updated. This method can be used to explicitly request synchronization (for example, to retry synchronization after it failed).

        Parameters:
        proxyHandle - the handle for the proxy; never null
        xstateHandle - the handle for the new external state, or null to use the latest state associated with the proxy
        syncedItemStateHandle - handle of the Jazz item state that is known to have been synchronized with the external object (i.e. after a manual merge), or null if the external object was independently modified
        syncRuleHandle - handle for the synchronization rule for the combination of external object type and Jazz item type, or null to use the synchronization rule already associated with the proxy
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • synchronizeIncomingAndWait

        IExternalProxy synchronizeIncomingAndWait(IExternalProxyHandle proxyHandle,
                                        IExternalStateHandle xstateHandle,
                                        IAuditableHandle syncedItemStateHandle,
                                        ISyncRuleHandle syncRuleHandle,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of a Jazz item with the state of an external object, and wait for the request to complete.

        If the request completes normally, the full state of the proxy object resulting from processing the request is returned. If the request did not complete normally (meaning that it was aborted or cancelled, not that there was a synchronization error), then null is returned.

        This operation adds the proxy to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        See #synchronizeIncoming(IExternalProxyHandle, IExternalStateHandle, ISyncRuleHandle) for details on how the request is processed.

        Parameters:
        proxyHandle - the handle of the proxy for the external object; never null
        xstateHandle - the handle for the new external state, or null to use the latest state associated with the proxy
        syncedItemStateHandle - handle of the Jazz item state that is known to have been synchronized with the external object (i.e. after a manual merge), or null if the external object was independently modified
        syncRuleHandle - the handle for the synchronization rule for the combination of external object type and Jazz item type, or null to use the synchronization rule already associated with the proxy
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a shared item for the state of the proxy after the synchronization request is completed, or null if the request was terminated early
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • synchronizeOutgoing

        void synchronizeOutgoing(IItemHandle itemHandle,
                       IExternalStateHandle syncedXstateHandle,
                       ISyncRuleHandle syncRuleHandle,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of an external object associated with a Jazz item, if there is one. (If not, this method is a no-op.)

        The synchronization request is put at the end of a queue of any other pending requests for the same proxy object, and this method returns immediately.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - handle to a Jazz item that may be associated with an external object
        syncedXstateHandle - handle of the external state that the Jazz item is known to have been synchronized with (i.e. after a manual merge), or null if the item was independently modified
        syncRuleHandle - handle for the synchronization rule for the combination of external object type and Jazz item type, or null to use the synchronization rule already associated with the proxy
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if no sync rule supplied and none associated with the proxy
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • synchronizeOutgoingAndWait

        IExternalProxy synchronizeOutgoingAndWait(IItemHandle itemHandle,
                                        IExternalStateHandle syncedXstateHandle,
                                        ISyncRuleHandle syncRuleHandle,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of an external object associated with a Jazz item, if there is one, and wait for the request to complete.

        If the request completes normally, the full state of the proxy object resulting from processing the request is returned. If the request did not complete normally (meaning that it was aborted or cancelled, not that there was a synchronization error), then null is returned.

        If a proxy is returned, this operation adds the proxy to the item manager and returns its shared item.

        This operation generates a shared item event.

        See #synchronizeOutgoing(IItemHandle, ISyncRuleHandle) for details on how the request is processed.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - handle to a Jazz item that may be associated with an external object; if the item has history and the handle does not identify a state, then the latest state of the item is used
        syncedXstateHandle - handle of the external state that the Jazz item is known to have been synchronized with (i.e. after a manual merge), or null if the item was independently modified
        syncRuleHandle - handle for the synchronization rule for the combination of external object type and Jazz item type, or null to use the synchronization rule already associated with the proxy
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a shared item for the state of the proxy after the synchronization request is completed, or null if the request was terminated early
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • synchronizeDeletion

        void synchronizeDeletion(IExternalProxyHandle proxyHandle,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of the deletion of a proxy for an external object. Any external state and links associated with the proxy are also deleted, but not the target Jazz item or external object.

        The synchronization request is put at the end of a queue of any other pending requests for the same proxy object, and this method returns immediately.

        Note that the item manager is not informed of any deleted items, because the deletion happens sometime later.

        Parameters:
        proxyHandle - the handle of the proxy for the external object; never null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • synchronizeDeletionAndWait

        void synchronizeDeletionAndWait(IExternalProxyHandle proxyHandle,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Schedule synchronization of the deletion of a proxy for an external object, and wait for the request to be processed.

        See #synchronizeDeletion(IExternalProxyHandle) for details on how the request is processed.

        This operation generates a shared item event if the item manager knows about the items being deleted.

        Parameters:
        proxyHandle - the handle of the proxy for the external object; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancelation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • setSynchronizeAllNewContributors

        void setSynchronizeAllNewContributors(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable the whether or not all contributors are synced out, or just ones associated with other synced objects. This method is for testing purposes only; It should be set via the server web UI
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the job, false to disable
